description: Glance needs to be added to the tools/pip-requires file so that Glance is installed into the virtualenv. Otherwise, tests will not run with a failed import glance....
title: run_tests.sh -V fails -- Need to add glance to tools/pip-requires

comments.content: Glance needs to be added to the tools/pip-requires file so that Glance is installed into the virtualenv. Otherwise, tests will not run with a failed import glance....
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: Note that just adding glance to tools/pip-requires won't work either, since the Glance that easy_install knows about in PyPI is Austin, which is way too old...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: The issue is that we uploaded two different packages with the same version into PyPI... working with mtaylor to resolve the issues...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes

comments.content: I still favor the idea of running all openstack components under the control of the developer and not of PyPI.  I know it has been useful in doing work in dashboard, and assume it would be helpful other places as well.  Regardless, you may want to pull the pep8 fixes from lp:~xtoddx/nova/glance-venv into your fix.  Hudson doesn't check it, but it just seems like a good idea.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~xtoddx

comments.content: glance 0.1.2 now uploaded to PyPI, so issuing a run_tests.sh -V -f will force a reload of glance and solve this issue
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jaypipes
